intro: Myosotis oreophila, commonly known as the alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers and lance-shaped leaves. This species typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high altitudes. Myosotis oreophila is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. It plays an important role in pollination and is often found in ecosystems with limited vegetation.
